page.title: 18Education-Coulsdon & Purley
page.content: Most children go to schools run by the state. Education is paid for by rates levied on all property, commercial and private. Children start infant school at five. Junior school is from seven to eleven. At secondary school, from eleven to sixteen, the curriculum is wide, but geared to exams. There is a teacher for each subject. You can leave school at sixteen, or you can go on to sixth form college. You can go to University or College at eighteen. There is a Primary system of education for which parents pay directly to the school. These private schools are very exam concious compared with state schools. There are special schools for handicapped children.
